Kompor Gas Meledak, Kebakaran Melanda Gerbong Kereta Api Ini
03 Nov 2019, 06:15 by Elmy Tasya Khairally


Foto: Kebakaran pada kereta api di Pakistan (AFP)

Pakistan - Sebuah kebakaran besar terjadi di atas kereta api di Pakistan disebabkan oleh kompor gas yang meledak. Peristiwa ini menewaskan 65 penumpang.Dilansir dari News Australia, Sabtu (2/11/2019) api berkobar melalui gerbong saat kereta mendekati Kota Liaquatur di Punjab, Pakistan. Wakil komisaris, Jamil Ahmed mengatakan, jumlah korban yang tewas terus meningkat sejak dini hari. Kebakaran ini terjadi saat sarapan disiapkan di atas kereta.Beberapa korban yang terluka melompat dari kereta. Banyak dari mereka yang meninggal ketika kebakaran terjadi.

[Gambas:Twitter]

Menteri Transportasi Pakistan, Syeikh Rashid Ahmed mengatakan bahwa korban yang tewas sekitar 65 orang. Kebakaran terjadi ketika waktu sarapan."Dua kompor meledak ketika sedang memasak sarapan. Adanya minyak tanah yang dibawa penumpang di kereta yang bergerak semakin menyebarkan api," kata Syeikh Rashid Ahmed.


Foto: Kebakaran hebat yang disebabkan kompor gas meledak menghanguskan kereta api (AFP)

Dia menambahkan, sebagian besar kematian yang terjadi pada orang-orang yang turun dari kereta. "Sebagian besar kematian terjadi karena orang-orang yang lompat dari kereta," kata Rashid.Ternyata kompor gas yang meledak adalah milik penumpang yang membawa kompor gas kecil dan memasak makanan mereka. Padahal telah ada peraturan yang melarang. Tetapi peraturan keselamatan seringkali diabaikan.Pihak berwajib mengatakan bahwa mereka masih berusaha mengidentifikasi para korban. Mereka belum bisa mendata korban yang terluka dan meninggal dunia.Kereta lain dikirim untuk membawa korban ke Kota Rawalpindi. Menteri Provinsi Punjab mengatakan bahwa staf medis memberikan perawatan terbaik untuk mereka yang terluka dan dirawat di rumah sakit LiaquaturSimak Video "Kompor Meledak di Kereta, 74 Penumpang Tewas"[Gambas:Video 20detik](elk/aff)

Gas Stove Explodes, Fire Strikes This Railroad Car
03 Nov 2019, 06:15 by Elmy Tasya Khairally


Photo: Fire on a train in Pakistan (AFP)

Pakistan - A large fire broke out on a train in Pakistan caused by a gas stove that exploded. This incident killed 65 passengers. Reported by News Australia, Saturday (11/02/2019) a fire blazed through the train as the train approached Liaquatur City in Punjab, Pakistan. Deputy commissioner, Jamil Ahmed said, the number of victims killed continues to increase since early morning. This fire occurred when breakfast was prepared on the train. Several injured victims jumped from the train. Many of them died when the fire broke out.

[Gambas: Twitter]

Pakistan's Transport Minister, Sheikh Rashid Ahmed said that the death toll was around 65 people. The fire broke out at breakfast time. "Two stoves exploded while cooking breakfast. The kerosene carried by passengers on a moving train increasingly spread the fire," Sheikh Rashid Ahmed said.


Photo: Severe fire caused by a gas stove exploded scorching the train (AFP)

He added that most of the deaths occurred in people who got off the train. "Most of the deaths occur because of people who jumped off trains," said Rashid. It turned out that the exploded gas stove belonged to passengers who were carrying small gas stoves and cooking their food. Even though there are regulations that forbid it. But safety regulations are often ignored. The authorities say that they are still trying to identify the victims. They have not been able to record the victims who were injured and died. Another train was sent to take the victims to Rawalpindi City. The Minister of the Punjab Province said that the medical staff provided the best care for those who were injured and were treated at the Liaquatur hospital.
